solution_line_template: First find how many degrees the temperature of the water needs to increase: {final_temperature} degrees - {initial_temperature} degrees = <<{final_temperature}-{initial_temperature}={temperature_increase_needed}>>{temperature_increase_needed} degrees

Then divide that amount by the number of degrees the water temperature increases each minute to find how long it takes the water to boil: {temperature_increase_needed} degrees / {temperature_increase_per_minute} degrees/minute = <<{temperature_increase_needed}/{temperature_increase_per_minute}={time_to_boil}>>{time_to_boil} minutes

Now figure out how long it takes to mix the pasta and make salad by dividing the pasta cook time by {mixing_salad_divisor}: {pasta_cook_time} minutes / {mixing_salad_divisor} = <<{pasta_cook_time}/{mixing_salad_divisor}={time_to_mix_salad}>>{time_to_mix_salad} minutes

Now add the boiling time, cook time, and mixing time to find the total time it takes to make dinner: {time_to_boil} minutes + {time_to_mix_salad} minutes + {pasta_cook_time} minutes = <<{time_to_boil}+{time_to_mix_salad}+{pasta_cook_time}={total_dinner_time}>>{total_dinner_time} minutes
